comments.comment: is utility a part of Tensorflow? Can you provide the directory you are in?

is utility a part of Tensorflow? Can you provide the directory you are in?
I don't think the utility folder exists I'm just copying a book

Yes. Absolutely.
should i downgrade the tensorflow same as book ?
Downgrading Tensorflow may not help, i guess. Utility maybe a different library.
Hi, sorry but this is not a tensorflow issue. In your example, utility is some kind of third-party package, or home-made library, not a part of tensorflow, as is clear from your import syntax.

Hi, sorry but this is not a tensorflow issue. In your example, utility is some kind of third-party package, or home-made library, not a part of tensorflow, as is clear from your import syntax.
THANKs for help

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tonyamrtin>@tonyamrtin</denchmark-link>
This question is better asked on <denchmark-link:http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged//tensorflow>StackOverflow</denchmark-link> since it is not a bug or feature request. There is also a larger community that reads questions there. Hence moving this issue to resolved status.
